content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's the `wrap_string` function in Julia:
```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(text, ' ')
    wrapped_lines = String[]
    
    current_line = ""
    for word in words
        if occursin(r"^\s+$", word) || 
           (length(current_line) + length(word)) > text_width)
            push!(wrapped_lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            current_line *= " " * word
        end
    end
    
    push!(wrapped_lines, current_line)
    join(wrapped_lines, "\n")
end
```
And here's an example usage of the `wrap_string` function:
```julia
text = """
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.
Nullam in turpis vitae justo facilisis posuere.
Praesent id felis eu lectus elementum auctor nec mi."""
wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```
This will output the wrapped text according to the specified `text_width`.
